meanings.definition: To make smooth or glossy by applying a liquid or oily substance.
meanings.sent1: She was slicking her hair back with gel for the party.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic was slicking the engine parts with oil to reduce friction.
meanings.sent3: The cat was slicking its fur with its tongue, trying to look extra fancy.
meanings.sent4: The artist was slicking the canvas with paint, creating a shiny masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The chef was slicking the pan with butter, ensuring nothing would stick.

meanings.definition: To make something sleek or neat by smoothing or arranging.
meanings.sent1: He was slicking his tie before the job interview.
meanings.sent2: The stylist was slicking the model's hair for the fashion show.
meanings.sent3: The gardener was slicking the bushes into perfect shapes, like living sculptures.
meanings.sent4: The designer was slicking the layout of the magazine, making it look professional.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was slicking the classroom, organizing everything neatly for the students.

meanings.sent1: The ice rink had a slicking surface, perfect for skating.
meanings.sent2: The wet road turned into a slicking danger zone for drivers.
meanings.sent3: The soap made the bathtub a slicking playground for bubbles.
meanings.sent4: The oil spill created a slicking mess on the ocean, harming marine life.
meanings.sent5: The polished marble floor was a slicking hazard for anyone wearing socks.
